BRIEF DESCRIPTION OF THE TARGET POPULATION RESIDENTS OF (AND NEARBY TO) THE MOLE LAKE RESERVATION. THE TARGET POPULATION IS PRIMARILY SCC TRIBAL MEMBERS AND TRIBAL EMPLOYEES.  88% OF SCC TRIBAL MEMBERS IDENTIFY AS NATIVE AMERICAN. BECAUSE THE SOKAOGON CHIPPEWA COMMUNITY HEALTH CLINIC IS A TRIBAL 638 TITLE I HEALTH CLINIC LOCATED ON THE SCC MOLE LAKE RESERVATION, THE OVERWHELMING MAJORITY OF PATIENTS ARE SCC TRIBAL MEMBERS AND TRIBAL EMPLOYEES (MOST OF WHOM ARE THEMSELVES SCC MEMBERS). THIS DATA IS REPORTED BY THE CENSUS BUREAU AND THE CLINIC ALSO TRACKS A RANGE OF PATIENT DEMOGRAPHICS.

SMDC TMG-HEALTH MANAGEMENT INFRASTRUCTURE PROJECT - APPLICANT: SYCUAN MEDICAL DENTAL CENTER ELIGIBLE ENTITY TYPE: INDIAN TRIBE (IHS/MOA TITLE I, ISDEAA CONTRACT) FUNDING PROGRAM: TRIBAL MANAGEMENT PROJECT TYPE: HEALTH MANAGEMENT STRUCTURE PROJECT PERIOD: TWO-YEARS (2023-2025) PROJECT DIRECTOR: MAURICE SMITH, SMDC EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR  THE SYCUAN BAND OF THE KUMEYAAY NATION (SMDC) IS A FEDERALLY RECOGNIZED TRIBE OF MISSION INDIANS FROM SOUTHERN CALIFORNIA, LOCATED IN AN UNINCORPORATED AREA OF SAN DIEGO COUNTY JUST EAST OF EL CAJON. THE SYCUAN MEDICAL DENTAL CENTER IS OWNED AND OPERATED BY THE SYCUAN BAND OF THE KUMEYAAY NATION, A SOVEREIGN NATIVE AMERICAN TRIBE. SMDC WAS ESTABLISHED IN 1972 AS A MEDICAL DENTAL CENTER FOR THE SYCUAN BAND OF KUMEYAAY NATION TRIBAL MEMBERS AND COMMUNITY.  IN MAY 2005, SMDC BEGAN CONTRACTING WITH CALIFORNIA AREA OFFICE (CAO), INDIAN HEALTH SERVICE, AS AN INDIAN HEALTH SERVICE (IHS) / MEMORANDUM OF AGREEMENT (MOA) TITLE I TRIBAL ORGANIZATION OF THE INDIAN SELF-DETERMINATION AND EDUCATION ASSISTANCE ACT (ISDEAA), PUBLIC LAW 93-638.  IN 2021, IHS/CAO CONDUCTED A PERFORMANCE EVALUATION ASSESSMENT OF THE SYCUAN MEDICAL DENTAL CENTER (SMDC). THE EVALUATIVE SURVEY REPORT IDENTIFIED THE NEED TO ENHANCE AND DEVELOP ITS MANAGEMENT CAPABILITY WITH RESPECT TO THE TRIBE’S HEALTH SERVICES. AS A RESULT OF THE IHS SUMMARY REPORT, THE TRIBAL COUNCIL TOOK THE RECOMMENDATIONS SERIOUSLY AND SHORTLY THEREAFTER BEGAN THE PROCESS OF DEVELOPING A HEALTH BOARD CHARTER (HEREINAFTER THE “HEALTH OVERSIGHT COMMITTEE”) AND STANDING COMMITTEES AS MEMORIALIZED THROUGH A CHARTER.  OUR OVER-ARCHING PROJECT GOAL IS TO ENHANCE AND DEVELOP SYCUAN MEDICAL DENTAL CENTER’S MANAGEMENT CAPABILITY WITH RESPECT TO THE TRIBE'S HEALTH SERVICES. THIS WILL BE ATTAINED BY ACCOMPLISHING THREE (3) OBJECTIVES BY THE END OF THE PROJECT PERIOD (2023 – 2025).  OBJECTIVE 1 – CREATE A GOVERNING BODY & STANDING COMMITTEES OBJECTIVE 2 – POLICY AND PROCEDURE DEVELOPMENT & MANAGEMENT SYSTEM OBJECTIVE 3 – ELECTRONIC HEALTH RECORD UPDATE/UPGRADE & TRAININGS  BUDGET REQUEST: YEAR 1 – $149,434 YEAR 2 – $78,537
LST HEALTH MANAGEMENT AND GOVERNANCE STRUCTURES

DAVID C. WYNECOOP MEMORIAL CLINIC FEASIBILITY STUDY - THE PURPOSE OF THE DAVID C. WYNECOOP MEMORIAL CLINIC FEASIBILITY STUDY IS TO SEE HOW FEASIBLE IT WOULD BE TO 638 THE DAVID C. WYNECOOP MEMORIAL CLINIC. WE PROPOSE CONTRACTING SERVICES WITH AN EXTERNAL VENDOR TO COMPLETE THE FEASIBILITY STUDY. THE DAVID C. WYNECOOP MEMORIAL CLINIC IS OPERATED AND RAN BY INDIAN HEALTH SERVICES (IHS) CURRENTLY. THIS GRANT WILL HELP DETERMINE IF THE TRIBE HAS THE CAPABILITY TO PROPERLY ADMINISTER THE CLINIC ON THE RESERVATION.

PUEBLO OF LAGUNA 2023 TMG PLANNING GRANT - THE PUEBLO OF LAGUNA (POL) IS REQUESTING A ONE-YEAR TRIBAL MANAGEMENT GRANT (TMG) IN THE AMOUNT OF $50,000 TO EXPLORE IF THE PUEBLO CAN ASSUME ALL OF THE IHS PROGRAMS, FUNCTIONS, SERVICES AND ACTIVITIES (PFSA’S). THIS PLANNING WILL IDENTIFY CURRENT DATA COLLECTION SYSTEMS IN USE AND TO THE EXTENT ANALYSIS OF THE DATASETS ASSIST MANAGERS AND PUEBLO COUNCIL IN IDENTIFYING HEALTH NEEDS, GAPS IN SERVICE AND DEVELOPING AND PRIORITIZING HEALTH SERVICES. USE OF DATA IS A VITAL TOOL FOR ORGANIZATIONAL AND MANAGEMENT OF EXISTING IHS PFSA’S. DATA DRIVEN METRICS AIDES IN ESTABLISHING PERFORMANCE MEASURES FOR HEALTH SERVICES, STRENGTHENING INTERNAL CONTROLS AND CAPABILITIES AND DEVELOPING A STRATEGIC HEALTH PLAN SPECIFIC TO PUEBLO OF LAGUNA MEMBERS AND USER POPULATION. THIS BASIC QUESTION IS CRITICAL IF THE PUEBLO WANTS TO PURSUE A FULL TITLE V COMPACT. THE PUEBLO JUST COMPLETED A THIRD-YEAR AUDIT WITH NO SIGNIFICANT OR MATERIAL AUDIT EXCEPTIONS. THE PUEBLO COUNCIL HAS EXPRESSED FIRM INTEREST IN TITLE V COMPACTING AND DIRECTED THE EXECUTIVE BRANCH AND TRIBAL OPERATIONS TO PURSUE PLANNING FUNDS TO ESTABLISH WHICH PORTIONS OF THE HEALTH CARE DELIVERY SYSTEMS ARE EFFECTIVE AND ACCEPTABLE BY INDIAN HEALTH SERVICE. CONVERSELY, TO IDENTIFY AREAS AND SYSTEMS NEEDING SIGNIFICANT IMPROVEMENT AND DEVELOP MITIGATION PLANS AND METHODS. IN 2013, THE PUEBLO CONTRACTED SHARES FOR PUBLIC HEALTH NURSING AND HEALTH EDUCATION PROGRAMS FROM THE I.H.S.  IN 2016, THE LAGUNA HEALTH CARE CORPORATION (LHCC) WAS CHARTERED WHICH DEVELOPED AND IMPLEMENTED PLANS FOR SECURING HOSPITALS AND CLINICS SHARES FROM ACL SERVICE UNIT AND ALBUQUERQUE AREA SHARES. IN FEBRUARY 2021, DURING THE COVID 19 PANDEMIC THE LHCC OPENED A NEW HEALTH CLINIC FOR THE PUEBLO OF LAGUNA MEMBERS AND ANY NATIVE AMERICAN PATIENT.

LAC COURTE OREILLES HEALTH SYSTEMS OIG COMPLIANCE PROGRAM INITIATIVE - THE LAC COURTE OREILLES BAND OF LAKE SUPERIOR CHIPPEWA INDIANS IS APPLYING FOR THE FY 2023 INDIAN HEALTH SERVICE TRIBAL MANAGEMENT GRANT TO ADDRESS MATERIAL AND ORGANIZATIONAL WEAKNESSES AS FOUND IN ACCORDANCE WITH OFFICE OF INSPECTOR GENERAL COMPLIANCE REGULATIONS PERTAINING TO INDIAN HEALTHCARE IMPROVEMENT ACT REAUTHORIZATION OF 2010 AND THIRD-PARTY BILLING. THE LAC COURTE OREILLES COMMUNITY HEALTH CENTER IS IN IMMEDIATE JEOPARDY OF LOSING THE ABILITY TO BILL THIRD-PARTY INSURANCES FOR OUR CLINICAL AND BEHAVIORAL HEALTH SERVICES PROVIDED TO OUR SERVICE POPULATION. HIRING AN OUTSIDE CONSULTANT TO PROVIDE A COMPREHENSIVE AUDIT, LEAD WITH THE DEVELOPMENT OF OIG COMPLIANT POLICIES AND PROCEDURES, AND IMPLEMENTATION OF A CORRECTIVE ACTION PLAN TO SUSTAIN OIG COMPLIANCE WILL ASSIST THE TRIBE AND STAFF OF THE LCO CHC TO MEET OUR GOAL OF IMPROVING AND MAINTAINING OIG COMPLIANCE.

KO-KWEL WELLNESS CENTER EPIC IMPLEMENTATION PROJECT - PROJECT ABSTRACT  PROJECT TITLE:  IMPLEMENTATION OF EPIC; ELECTRONIC HEALTH RECORD SYSTEM  TRIBAL MANAGEMENT GRANT PROGRAM REQUEST:  $150,000 – ONE YEAR PROJECT PERIOD  THE WELLNESS DIVISION OF THE COQUILLE INDIAN TRIBE LOCATED IN NORTH BEND, OREGON IS REQUESTING $150,000 IN FUNDS FROM THE TRIBAL MANAGEMENT GRANT PROGRAM THROUGH THE INDIAN HEALTH SERVICE – DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES. IF OUR APPLICATION IS AWARDED, THIS FUNDING WILL BE USED TO SUPPORT THE IMPLEMENTATION OF A NEW ELECTRONIC HEALTH RECORD DATABASE, CALLED “EPIC.” THIS IS AN ALLOWABLE REQUEST AS LISTED UNDER TMG PROJECT TYPE 4 - HEALTH MANAGEMENT STRUCTURE. THIS SERVICE WILL BE AVAILABLE FOR PATIENTS AND CLIENTS OF BOTH KO-KWEL WELLNESS CENTER LOCATIONS IN EUGENE, OREGON AND COOS BAY, OREGON. BOTH THESE LOCATIONS HAVE BEEN WORKING DILIGENTLY TO INCREASE REVENUE THROUGH OPTIMIZING CERTAIN PROCESSES INCLUDING AN INCREASE IN VISITS AND PROVIDERS IN BOTH CLINIC LOCATIONS. OVER THE LAST SEVERAL YEARS, CLINIC ADMINISTRATORS AND PROVIDERS HAVE EXPRESSED CONCERNS OVER THE CURRENT SOFTWARE. THE USE OF EPIC WILL PROVIDE AN EXTREMELY POSITIVE IMPACT TO DELIVERY OF QUALITY PATIENT CARE DUE TO ALIGNING OUR SYSTEMS WITH OTHER MEDICAL CLINICS LOCATED IN COOS COUNTY AND LANE COUNTY THAT ALSO USE EPIC, INCLUDING BAY AREA HOSPITAL, NORTH BEND MEDICAL CLINIC AND BAY CLINIC. THE USE OF ONE SYSTEM WILL INCREASE COORDINATION CAPABILITIES BETWEEN THE VARIOUS MEDICAL CLINICS. THIS WILL INCREASE COLLABORATION AND INTERCONNECTEDNESS BETWEEN FACILITIES AND ALIGN OUR EFFORTS TO MEET PATIENT DEMANDS AND HEALTH CARE NEEDS.  EPIC WILL PROVIDE VARIOUS COST SAVING MEASURES FOR THE COQUILLE INDIAN TRIBE DUE TO STREAMLINING THE BILLING AND CODING PROCESS. WE WILL HAVE FEWER DATA AND REPORTING ISSUES WHICH CREATES A MUCH EASIER APPROACH TO REPORTING AND DATA SHARING. OUR CURRENT REPORTING SYSTEM DOES NOT ALLOW FOR AUTOMATION, WHICH REQUIRES US TO COMPLETE MANUAL CHART AUDITS, WHICH CREATES LOST PRODUCTIVITY. THIS LOSS OF TIME AND EFFORT COULD BE USED FOR DIRECT PATIENT CARE AND OVERALL WORKFLOW EFFICIENCIES.  THE COQUILLE INDIAN TRIBE WAS RESTORED AS A FEDERALLY RECOGNIZED TRIBE IN 1989 AFTER HAVING BEEN TERMINATED IN THE 1950’S. CURRENTLY, THERE ARE A TOTAL OF 1,185 ENROLLED COQUILLE TRIBAL MEMBERS WHO LIVE IN VARIOUS PARTS OF THE COUNTRY AND THE WORLD. THE TRIBE’S FIVE-COUNTY SERVICE AREA CONSTITUTES A LAND MASS OF OVER 15,603 SQUARE MILES AND INCLUDES COOS, CURRY, DOUGLAS, JACKSON, AND LANE COUNTIES. 572 ENROLLED TRIBAL MEMBERS LIVE INSIDE THIS FIVE-COUNTY SERVICE AREA.
SIHC'S TMG STUDY

CHEMEHUEVI HEALTH MANAGEMENT PROGRAM 2023 - THE CHEMEHUEVI INDIAN TRIBE IS APPLYING FOR THE INDIAN HEALTH SERVICE FUNDING AVAILABLE FOR THE TRIBAL MANAGEMENT GRANT, FEASIBILITY STUDY TO EXPLORE THE OPTIONS FOR ASSUMING PROGRAMS, SERVICES, FUNCTIONS, AND ACTIVITIES (PSFAS) OR PORTIONS WHICH WILL GIVE THE TRIBE THE AUTHORITY TO MANAGE HEALTH CARE PROGRAMS THAT BEST FIT THE NEEDS OF THE TRIBAL MEMBERS AND COMMUNITY.

FY23 PN IHS TMG - THE PAWNEE NATION, A FEDERALLY RECOGNIZED TRIBE LOCATED IN PAWNEE, OKLAHOMA, IS SEEKING FUNDING FOR A TRIBAL MANAGEMENT GRANT, PROJECT TYPE 4 (HEALTH MANAGEMENT STRUCTURE), PRIORITY GROUP IV. THE FEDERAL FUNDING REQUEST IS FOR $300,000 FOR A 3-YEAR PROJECT PERIOD.  OVERALL GOAL: TO DEFINE AND DEVELOP A COMPREHENSIVE HEALTH MANAGEMENT INFRASTRUCTURE SYSTEM TO ASSIST THE NATION IN ELEVATING THEIR HEALTH MANAGEMENT CAPABILITIES TO PROVIDE, IMPROVE AND EXPAND THE NATION’S ABILITY TO ADDRESS THE NEEDS OF THE TARGET POPULATION AND PROVIDE THE HIGHEST STANDARD OF HEALTHCARE SERVICES SO FOUNDATIONAL COMPONENTS OF THE INFRASTRUCTURE CAN BE IDENTIFIED AND DEVELOPED.  OBJECTIVE 1: PROJECT INITIATION. OBJECTIVE 2: IDENTIFY PAWNEE NATION HEALTHCARE RESOURCES. OBJECTIVE 3: ESTABLISH A PAWNEE NATION HEALTH ACT. OBJECTIVE 4: PAWNEE NATION HEALTH BOARD POLICY AND PROCEDURE MANUAL. OBJECTIVE 5: PAWNEE NATION HEALTH BOARD APPOINTMENTS. OBJECTIVE 6: ONGOING MEETINGS, TRAINING AND TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE. OBJECTIVE 7: PAWNEE NATION HEALTHCARE DELIVERY SYSTEM ORGANIZATIONAL CHART. OBJECTIVE 8: BUSINESS OFFICE ESTABLISHMENT AND INITIATION. OBJECTIVE 9: THIRD-PARTY BILLING SYSTEM. OBJECTIVE 10: CREDENTIALING AND PRIVILEGING. OBJECTIVE 11: HEALTH STRUCTURE DETERMINATION. OBJECTIVE 12: 105(L) LEASING. OBJECTIVE 13: PROGRAM EVALUATION/GRANT ADMINISTRATION.  OUTCOMES: THE PROJECT WILL RESULT IN DEVELOPMENT OF A HEALTH BOARD ACT, ESTABLISHMENT OF A HEALTH BOARD AND A POLICIES AND PROCEDURES MANUAL, DEVELOPMENT OF A 3-TO-5-YEAR PLAN FOR FUTURE PAWNEE NATION HEALTH GOALS THAT WILL BE SUBMITTED TO THE PAWNEE BUSINESS COUNCIL FOR APPROVAL.  OTHER OUTCOMES INCLUDE ONGOING TRAINING AND TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE TRAININGS THROUGHOUT THE PROJECT PERIOD TO ENHANCE KNOWLEDGE OF REGULATORY GRANT REQUIREMENTS AND APPLICABLE HEALTH CARE FEDERAL REGULATIONS WHICH WILL INCREASE CAPACITY BUILDING AND SPECIALIZED KNOWLEDGE. DEVELOPMENT OF A PAWNEE NATION HEALTHCARE DELIVERY SYSTEM ORGANIZATIONAL CHART TO BE APPROVED BY THE PAWNEE BUSINESS COUNCIL. ESTABLISHMENT OF A HEALTH BUSINESS OFFICE AND IDENTIFICATION OF REQUIREMENTS FOR ACCREDITATION. ESTABLISHMENT OF A THIRD PARTY BILLING SYSTEM AND APPLICATION SUBMITTED FOR APPROVAL TO BILL FOR REIMBURSEMENT OF THE HIS ALL-INCLUSIVE REIMBURSEMENT RATE FOR THE PROVISION OF HEALTH SERVICES.

MYCITC SUPPORT - COOK INLET TRIBAL COUNCIL, INC. (CITC) WILL CONTRACT WITH CITC ENTERPRISES, INC. FOR TECHNICAL SUPPORT IN ESTABLISHING NEW FUNCTIONALITY IN CITC'S ELECTRONIC HEALTH RECORD SYSTEM.  THE PROJECT WILL ULTIMATELY SUPPORT A STRATEGIC SHIFT IN CITC’S MANAGEMENT OF DATA BY 1) MIGRATING THE AGENCY’S BEHAVIORAL HEALTH PROGRAMS FROM A LEGACY CUSTOM-BUILT SYSTEM TO CONTEMPORARY COMMERCIALLY AVAILABLE SYSTEMS BUILT WITH MODERN SECURITY AND SYSTEM INTEGRATION FUNCTIONS IN MIND, 2) SUPPORTING PARTICIPANTS’ ACCESS TO THEIR OWN DATA THROUGH A SECURE ON-LINE PORTAL, AND 3) ENABLING SECURE JOINT CASE MANAGEMENT WITH OTHER CITC SERVICE DEPARTMENTS PROVIDING EMPLOYMENT AND TRAINING SERVICES, CHILDCARE, PARENTING AND CHILD WELFARE SUPPORT, AND CONNECTIONS TO CULTURAL SERVICES.

ROSEBUD SIOUX TRIBE HEALTH ADMINISTRATION HEALTH MANAGEMENT STRUCTURE PROJECT WILL ANALYZE CURRENT TRIBAL HEALTH MANAGEMENT STRUCTURE AND IMPLEMENT CHANGES NEEDED TO MANAGE AN ASSUMPTION OF SERVICES - THE SICANGU LAKOTA OYATE, ALSO KNOWN AS THE ROSEBUD SIOUX TRIBE (RST), IS ONE OF THE 574 FEDERALLY RECOGNIZED AMERICAN INDIAN TRIBAL GOVERNMENTS IN THE UNITED STATES. THE SICANGU ARE ONE OF THE SEVEN LAKOTA TRIBES, WHICH TOGETHER WITH ALL DAKOTA AND NAKOTA TRIBES COMPOSE THE OCETI SAKOWIN (TRANSLATED DIRECTLY IN ENGLISH AS THE “SEVEN COUNCIL FIRES” AND ALSO KNOWN AS THE “GREAT SIOUX NATION”). THE RST IS A NATIVE SOVEREIGN NATION LOCATED ON THE ROSEBUD INDIAN RESERVATION. THE RST HEALTH ADMINISTRATION IS THE TRIBAL GOVERNMENT AGENCY CREATED FOR OVERSEEING THE MASTER 638 AGREEMENT AND RESPONSIBLE FOR ADMINISTERING AND OVERSEEING TRIBAL HEALTH AND PUBLIC HEALTH SERVICES. THE RST HEALTH ADMINISTRATION DESIRES TO EVALUATE, IDENTIFY, AND IMPLEMENT VARIOUS PROCESSES FOR IMPROVEMENT OF THEIR HEALTHCARE DELIVERY SYSTEM AS PRESENTLY CONTRACTED WITH THE INDIAN HEALTH SERVICE. THE RST HEALTH BOARD, TRIBAL HEALTH DIRECTOR, AND OTHER REPRESENTATIVES FROM KEY STAKEHOLDERS WILL ALSO EXAMINE WHETHER THE REDESIGN AND CONSOLIDATION OF ANY PFSA’S ARE LIKELY TO BETTER MEET THE NEEDS OF THE TRIBAL COMMUNITY OR OTHERWISE IMPROVE HEALTH OUTCOMES. TWO PRIMARY PARTNER ORGANIZATIONS WHO WILL ACT AS CONSULTANTS UNDER THE PROPOSED PROJECT ARE TRIBALHEALTH ALLIANCE AND NATIVE COMMAND CONSULTING, BOTH 100% NATIVE-OWNED COMPANIES THAT SPECIALIZE IN PROVIDING SERVICES TO TRIBAL COMMUNITIES.  THE OVERALL GOAL OF THE PROJECT IS TO DEFINE, DEVELOP AND IMPROVE THE RST HEALTH ADMINISTRATION MANAGEMENT STRUCTURE THAT PERTAINS TO;  A) RESTRUCTURE AND IMPROVEMENT OF THE BUSINESS PROCESSES, BILLING AND CODING FOR COVERED SERVICES OF MEDICARE AND MEDICAID, B) IMPROVING THE SUD STAFF CREDENTIALING PROCESSES, ENHANCING QUALITY IMPROVEMENT, AND PREPARING FOR ACCREDITATION THROUGH COMMISSION ON ACCREDITATION OF REHABILITATION FACILITIES (CARF), C) DEVELOPING A STRATEGIC HEALTH SERVICES PLAN THROUGH CONDUCTING AN EXTENSIVE COMMUNITY HEALTH NEEDS ASSESSMENT, AND D) ESTABLISHING A TRIBAL SPECIFIC INSTITUTIONAL REVIEW BOARD (IRB) TO PARTICIPATE AND GUIDE STUDIES AND RESEARCH WITHIN THEIR TRIBAL COMMUNITY.  TO DEVELOP INTERNAL CAPACITIES AMONG LEADERSHIP THE TRIBE WILL ESTABLISH A CORE MANAGEMENT TEAM (CTM) TO PROVIDE OVERSIGHT TO CONSULTANTS AND WORK PRODUCT RECOMMENDATIONS.

IHS TRIBAL MANAGEMENT GRANT PROGRAM - THE AK-CHIN INDIAN COMMUNITY (ACIC), “COMMUNITY,” IS REQUESTING A ONE-YEAR TRIBAL MANAGEMENT GRANT (TMG) IN THE AMOUNT OF $100,000 TO ENHANCE AND DEVELOP OUR HEALTH MANAGEMENT INFRASTRUCTURE. THE TMG WILL ASSIST THE ACIC TO FURTHER DEVELOP AND IMPROVE ORGANIZATIONAL AND MANAGEMENT CAPABILITIES AS WELL AS MANAGE EXISTING AND ADDITIONAL INDIAN HEALTH SERVICE (IHS) PROGRAMS, SERVICES, FUNCTIONS AND ACTIVITIES; OR PORTIONS THEREOF; (PSFAS) UNDER OUR TITLE V INDIAN SELF-DETERMINATION AND EDUCATION ASSISTANCE ACT (ISDEAA) SELF-GOVERNANCE COMPACT.  ACIC NEGOTIATED OUR FIRST SELF-GOVERNANCE COMPACT AND FUNDING AGREEMENT EFFECTIVE ON JANUARY 1, 2019, FOLLOWING AN EXTENSIVE THREE-YEAR SELF-GOVERNANCE PLANNING AND NEGOTIATION PROCESS. THE INITIAL 2019 ACIC FUNDING AGREEMENT INCLUDED ASSUMPTION OF THE EMERGENCY MANAGEMENT SERVICES (WHICH WAS PREVIOUSLY OPERATED BY ACIC UNDER AN ISDEAA TITLE I CONTRACT) AND THE SPECIAL DIABETES PROGRAM FOR INDIANS. THE FOLLOWING YEAR IN 2020, ACIC ASSUMED MANAGEMENT OF THE HEALTH EDUCATION PROGRAM AS A NEW PSFA; AND EFFECTIVE JANUARY 1, 2022, THE ACIC FURTHER EXPANDED AND ASSUMED OPERATION OF THE PURCHASED AND REFERRED CARE (PRC) PROGRAM FOR ACIC COMMUNITY MEMBERS. THE REMAINDER OF DIRECT HEALTH CARE SERVICES ARE PROVIDED TO ACIC UNDER THE GILA RIVER INDIAN COMMUNITY SELF-GOVERNANCE MULTI-YEAR AGREEMENT.  AS WE PLAN FOR ASSUMPTION OF NEW PSFAS, THE NEED FOR A THOROUGH REVIEW OF INTERNAL HEALTH OPERATIONS IS NOW TIMELY AND NECESSARY TO MANAGE AND ORGANIZE THESE PSFAS.  UNDER THIS TMG, ACIC INTENDS TO CAREFULLY EXAMINE AND EXPLORE HEALTH MANAGEMENT OPTIONS INCLUDING THE ESTABLISHMENT OF A HEALTH BOARD, HEALTH DEPARTMENT ORGANIZATION, AND FINANCIAL AND DATA SYSTEMS IN ORDER TO STRENGTHEN AND IMPROVE INTERNAL CONTROLS AND CAPABILITIES.  THE REQUESTED FUNDING UNDER THIS TMG APPLICATION WILL ALLOW THE ACIC COMMUNITY COUNCIL TO TAKE A MORE COMPREHENSIVE APPROACH IN DETERMINING THE BEST HEALTH CARE STRUCTURE FOR THE TRIBAL GOVERNMENT. CLEAR PROJECT OBJECTIVES, ACTIVITIES, DELIVERABLES AND TIMELINES HAVE BEEN IDENTIFIED FOR THE 1-YEAR GRANT PERIOD.  WITH OVERSIGHT BEING PROVIDED BY THE TMG PROJECT MANAGER, ACIC PLANS TO WORK WITH A QUALIFIED PROJECT CONSULTANT TO RESEARCH AND PROVIDE THE COMMUNITY COUNCIL (THE TRIBAL GOVERNING BODY) WITH OPTIONS AND FINDINGS TO DEVELOP A HEALTH SYSTEM MANAGEMENT PLAN.  THIS PLAN WILL PROVIDE CLEAR DIRECTION AND DESIGN FOR THE DELIVERY OF HEALTH CARE SERVICES, HIRING OF STAFF, AND MANAGEMENT OVERSIGHT FOR THE OPERATION OF CURRENT AND FUTURE PSFAS THAT MAY BE ASSUMED BY 2025.

MARIMN HEALTH TMG IT PROJECT - PROJECT ABSTRACT BENEWAH MEDICAL CENTER DBA MARIMN HEALTH HHS-2020-IHS-TMD-0001 CFDA 93.228 HEALTH MANAGEMENT STRUCTURE ONE YEAR/ $100,000 REQUEST 9/8/2020 – 9/7/2021   IN RESPONSE TO THE NOTICE OF FUNDING OPPORTUNITY HHS-2020- IHS-0001 TRIBAL MANAGEMENT GRANT, BENEWAH MEDICAL CENTER DBA MARIMN HEALTH (MH) IS REQUESTING $100,000, UNDER THE HEALTH MANAGEMENT STRUCTURE ONE-YEAR CATEGORY.  THIS PROPOSED FUNDING WILL SUPPORT THE INSTALLATION OF AN OPERATIONAL NETWORK SYSTEM AND SECURITY SYSTEM AT THE WORLEY CENTER. THIS CENTER WAS DESIGNED TO EXPAND ACCESS TO PREVENTATIVE, TREATMENT, AND REFERRAL SERVICES FOR THOSE MEMBERS OF OUR POPULATION CONSIDERED HIGH RISK.  THE CENTER IS IN RESPONSE TO THE MARIMN HEALTH STRATEGIC PLAN (FY 2019-2020) WHICH IDENTIFIED A NEED TO IMPLEMENT A FACILITIES EXPANSION WITH IMPROVED ACCESS TO CARE THAT INCLUDED THE SYSTEMATIC MANAGEMENT OF CARE FOR THE HIGH RISK POPULATION WITHIN OUR AREA.  OUR MARIMN HEALTH CENTER IT DEPARTMENT ADAPTED AND IMPROVED ITS IT INFRASTRUCTURE AND STRENGTHENED ITS MANAGEMENT INFORMATION SYSTEM IN RESPONSE TO THIS NEED.  BECAUSE THE WORLEY SITE DOES NOT HAVE LOCAL ACCESS TO THE MARIMN HEALTH CLINIC IT DEPARTMENT, INSTALLATION OF THE OPERATIONAL SYSTEM IS NECESSARY.  THE PROPOSED PLAN IS FOR THE PURCHASE OF NETWORK EQUIPMENT; ROUTER AND SWITCHES, A SERVER, WIRELESS SYSTEM AND A RECORDER.  THIS EQUIPMENT WILL BE INSTALLED BY MARIMN HEALTH IT DEPARTMENT.  MARIMN WILL CONTRACT WITH A VENDOR FOR THE PURCHASE AND INSTALLATION OF SECURITY VIDEO CAMERAS.  INSTALLATION OF THESE SYSTEMS WILL ENHANCE DELIVERY OF ACCURATE, TIMELY AND EFFICIENT SERVICES, AS WELL AS, ESTABLISH A SUSTAINABLE SYSTEM WHICH IS PROJECTED TO POSITIVELY IMPROVE MANAGEMENT CAPABILITIES AND IMPROVE PATIENT CARE.  WITH THE EXPANSION OF PREVENTION, TREATMENT AND REFERRAL SERVICES AT THE WORLEY CENTER, THE ANTICIPATED BENEFIT TO THE COMMUNITY WILL BE A DECREASE IN HIGH RISK BEHAVIORS WITH A SUBSEQUENT INCREASE IN HEALTHY LIFE STYLES.  PLANS INCLUDE ON-GOING MONITORING FOR THREE YEARS AFTER PROJECT IMPLEMENTATION TO ENSURE QUALITY IMPROVEMENT AND SUCCESSFUL PATIENT OUTCOMES.
